What is Production Part Approval Process: What is Production Part Approval Process (PPAP)?
You can start publishing your catalogue: You can start publishing your catalogue
In order to execute business processes y: In order to execute business processes your company needs to be verified by an administrator - please stay tuned
If you are not being verified with 24h,: If you are not being verified with 24h, please contact our support
Approval PPAP: The Production Part Approval Process (PPAP) is a standardized process that helps manufacturers and suppliers communicate and approve production designs and processes before, during, and after manufacture
What is the goal of the PPAP process?: What is the goal of the PPAP process?
Goal of PPAP: The goal of the PPAP process is to ensure that all designs and specifications are understood by the supplier and that the production process and produce products that consistently meet these requirements when running at rate
What is the meaning of the PPAP levels?: What is the meaning of the PPAP levels?
PPAP levels indicate: The PPAP levels indicate which elements need to be submitted to the customer
ppadoclevel5: Level 5 – PSW with product samples and complete supporting data available for review at the supplier’s manufacturing location
ppadoclevel4: Level 4 – PSW and other requirements as defined by the customer
ppadoclevel3: Level 3 – PSW with product samples and complete supporting data
ppadoclevel2: Level 2 – PSW with product samples and limited supporting data
ppadoclevel1: Level 1 - Part Submission Warrant (PSW) only submitted to the customer
1. Download the product / service catego: 1. Download the product / service category template
At least one category should be selected: At least one category should be selected!
Append mode: Already published products: Append mode: Already published products / services are updated if newer versions are provided in the template, new products / services are appended to the current catalogue.
Replace mode: All previously published i: Replace mode: All previously published items having the same categories specified in the template are deleted; and only the new ones are added to the catalogue.
3. Upload the template after filling it: 3. Upload the template after filling it with your product / service information
4. Upload a zip package: 4. Upload a 'zip package' including product / service images. Each image must be suffixed with the identifier of the product / service. For example: pid1.imageFile.jpg, pid1.imageFile2.png, etc.

help-modal-text:
This platform has only been developed for and tested on Chrome and Firefox. In case you are experiencing errors try using one of those browsers first.

When you press "Open manual" a PDF with an user manual will open in a new tab.

When you press "Contact support" a partially prefilled mail template will open in the mail client of your choice.
Please make sure to fill out the description and cause of the issue properly and add screenshots if they are of use.
We will get back to you within one business day.
